subject: 2019 IEEE International Symposium on Technology and Society (IEEE ISTAS 2019)
body:
IEEE ISTAS 2019 (Boston 15 - 16 November ) Call for Papers - Call for Reviewers and Other Volunteers

https://technologyandsociety.org/event/ieee-istas-2019-boston-15-16-november/

IEEE International Symposium on Technology and Society (IEEE ISTAS) is the flagship conference of the IEEE Society on Social Implications of Technology.

IEEE ISTAS 2019 is kindly hosted by the School of Engineering, Tufts University, Medford MA. Technical Co-Sponsors confirmed to date include IEEE Boston Section, IEEE-USA, IEEE Region 1 – Northeastern USA, IEEE Standards Association, IEEE Industrial Electronics Society, IEEE Reliability Society and IEEE Technology and Engineering Management Society.

___________________
Submission Deadlines
___________________

Paper submission deadline (4,000 – 5,000 Words): 16 August
Parallel Discussion Panel and Participatory Workshop Proposal Deadline: 16 August
Accept/Reject notification date: 16 September
Final Paper submission: 30 September
Author Registration Deadline: 30 September

___________________
Call for Reviewers and Other Volunteers

Volunteers willing to review a minimum of 5 - 6 paper submissions between mid August and mid September, and provide actionable, constructive feedback, please contact the Conference Chair, Prof. Paul M Cunningham (pcunningham@ieee.org) cc to secretariat.istas@gmail.com).


We would also appreciate volunteers to support stakeholder engagement and social media, support registration and help delegates onsite.
__________________
Confirmed Speakers include
- Gil Cooke, IEEE Boston Section (Welcome Address)
- Tom Coughlin, President IEEE-USA
- Babak Dastgheib-Beheshti, Region 1 Director
- Bob Dent, IEEE Society on Social Implications of Technology
- Xinghuo Yu, IEEE Industrial Electronics Society
- Carole D. Graas, President, IEEE Reliability Society
- John Allen, President, IEEE Product/Safety Engineering Society
- Russ Meier, President, IEEE Education Society
- Representative (tbc), IEEE Technology and Engineering Management Society
- Beth-Anne Schuelke-Leech, Chair, IEEE SSSIT Standards Committee
- John Havens, IEEE Standards Association - Plenary Panel on Ethical Standards

+++++++++
Call for Papers
+++++++++

We welcome proposals for papers, parallel discussion panels or participatory workshop sessions focused on the relationship between technology, policy and social issues ranging from economic and ethical to socio-cultural and environmental.


Priority will be given to submissions addressing one or more of SSIT’s Five Pillars

 • Sustainable Development (including ICT4D) and Humanitarian Technology
 • Ethics, Human Values and Technology
 • Universal Access
 • Societal Impacts of Technology
 • Protecting the Planet 

and Intersections between the Social Implications of Technology and other topics, including but not limited to:
  – Multi-Stakeholder Co-Design
  – Net-Neutrality
  – GEOValue, Climate, Environment & Sustainable Technologies
  – Ethical Standards, Autonomous Vehicles and Artificial Intelligence
  – Ethical Use of Big Data, Blockchain, Human Genome Editing, IoT, Neurotechnology & Open Data
  – Current Challenges in Technology Policy
  – Balancing National Security with Personal Privacy


Papers accepted for the Conference Proceedings will be submitted for publication in IEEE Xplore. Some papers may be selected for revision and publication in a special issue of IEEE Technology and Society Magazine and/or IEEE Transactions on Technology and Society.

Authors wishing to participate at the conference must register individually. Each accepted paper will be assigned one oral presentation in the program. Only papers actually presented at the Conference shall be included in the conference publications and be eligible for inclusion in the IEEE Xplore Digital Library.

For paper related queries, please contact secretariat.istas@gmail.com

IEEE Reliability: https://rs.ieee.org/
IEEE IEEE Society on Social Implications of Technology: https://technologyandsociety.org/
IEEE TEMS: http://www.ieee-tems.org/
IEEE USA: https://ieeeusa.org/
